Find the /mem/ location block and change this line:
nginxproxy_pass http://<redacted.ip>:40001/mem/;
To:
nginxproxy_pass http://<redacted.ip>:40001/;
Then reload and test:
bashsudo nginx -t
sudo systemctl reload nginx

# Test the fixed endpoint
curl -I "https://api.nsgia.com/mem/get?id=1369de11-d01f-4cb5-9b37-87d26ef0677b&key=public-read-2025"

# Test both mem endpoints
curl -s "https://api.nsgia.com/mem/search?limit=1&key=public-read-2025" | head -5
curl -s "https://api.nsgia.com/mem/get?id=1369de11-d01f-4cb5-9b37-87d26ef0677b&key=public-read-2025" | head -5
This should fix the proxy path mapping and make the /mem/get endpoint return HTTP 200 instead of HTTP 401.
